metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28013 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 allows Heap-based Buffer Overflow because itmishandles "-F '.('" on the command line, and thus may allow privilegeescalation from any user to root. This occurs because of the interpretationof negative sizes in strncpy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28013` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-base - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-config - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
eximon4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.94-15ubuntu1.2').
